snippet: A divided federal appeals court on Tuesday overturned a ruling ordering state prison officials to provide taxpayer-funded sex-reassignment surgery for an inmate convicted of murder.
abstract: Federal appeals court decides 3-to-2 to overturn 2012 ruling ordering Massachusetts prison officials to provide taxpayer-funded sex-reassignment surgery for inmate Michelle Kosilek, born Robert Kosilek, who is serving a life sentence for killing her wife in 1990.
lead_paragraph: A divided federal appeals court on Tuesday overturned a ruling ordering state prison officials to provide taxpayer-funded sex-reassignment surgery for an inmate convicted of murder.

headline.main: Massachusetts: Sex-Change Surgery Denied to Inmate
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Sex-Change Surgery Denied to Inmate
